https://t.co/8vLY77qYXn

tweets.text:
Our team released our first open dataset, 100 Days of COVID-19 in the Australian Twittersphere, a few weeks ago! https://t.co/Hpw2wiv3AU

We hope that researchers find it useful!

The week is almost over... which means it's almost Open Access week! #OAweek2020 #openaccessaustralasia

https://t.co/a7RSAVfRU3

tweets.text: Less #QLDvotes2020 big events and doorknocking because of #COVID19 makes candidate campaigning online more important than in previous #elections. @qutdmrc Prof Axel Bruns @snurb_dot_info tells @PaulCulliver on ABC Capricornia. https://t.co/DpDaYzjltg (from 2:14:00) https://t.co/5oQ4ttB9Ki

And in case you're wondering, I ran a bot analysis of the top 500 most active accounts (by tweet volume).

🥁🥁🥁 

We only found one likely bot account! 

[🤓 thread with more details below] https://t.co/ehOy8yyEqt

It's been a bit of a mad scramble, but with my @qutdmrc colleagues I've now published a first analysis of the social media activities around the Queensland state election. More to come next week ! #QLDvotes 
https://t.co/Xv5uC1b3gI

tweets.text: At @qutdmrc in 2020 we are hiring 5 (FIVE) 3-year Level A postdocs for the new @arc_gov_au Centre of Excellence for Automated Decision-Making and Society. Two of these jobs are open now, including one in Critical Data Studies & Digital Methods (working with me) - please pass on! https://t.co/Q81TgPaGw8

tweets.text: Schweinberger et al at The Digital @ObservatoryTeam at @IFE_QUT creating tools text mining/ling analysis tools to analyse #COVID19 twitter data. They created a (prototype) time-sensitive text mining app that could differentiate btw diff topics (=sub-discourses)! #AusEng2020

Signing off for the week. Thanks everyone for the interest in our research here at @qutdmrc 

Stay tuned next week for preliminary results of a large scale study of #COVID19Vic hashtags, in collaboration with the amazing @ObservatoryTeam and @antmandan

Have a good weekend!

It was truly a privilege to contribute to this story on #mediawatch tonight. Australia has a growing problem with information disorder and it affects everyone, regardless of creed or political stripe https://t.co/9ECH2xm5Vi

👋#AusAcademics We are putting together a proposal to build an Australian research support infrastructure for digital/social media data. If you would benefit from support in terms of digital media data gathering and analytics then please sign up: https://t.co/1bUNTItU5Z

Thinking about learning R to use in your research but not sure where to start? 

QUT eResearch is running a comprehensive Introduction to R series of workshops starting 23 September. 

All QUT students & staff welcome, book through UniHub. First session: https://t.co/yhhjUsHatR

tweets.text: Now that Hacky Hour is at both campuses, GP at the Pantry and KG at Beadles, we thought we should change our Twitter handle. Take note, we are now @QUTHackyHour! https://t.co/UgHa2dmgil
KG Hacky Hour is on today at Beadles, Kelvin Grove 2-3pm. Bring your R and data problems and work with fellow researchers to troubleshoot together.  @ObservatoryTeam @qutlibrary
QUT researchers, check this training out! Did you know QUT is a QCIF member? https://t.co/kbWBlgkcE6

We had an awesome Hacky Hour talking about:
- transforming data in R
- HPC best practices
- comparing performance of classification & regression models
- predicting material performance
Alice is giving a lightning introduction to network/graph theory in advance of working through an example with Australian Twittersphere data #LoveDataWeek @qutlibrary https://t.co/UApZMTTxJi

#lovedataweek2020 @ QUT is about data storytelling. Read more @ https://t.co/O1PPoMrNyE. Come along & listen to @AmandaMiottoGU & @QuietAlice27 on Tuesday 10am 11/2 GP-P405. Register at https://t.co/T4jCR7wxAr

I guess it couldn't get any better than this! Received my PhD examination reports with both examiners recommending *no* revisions and nominating me for the Outstanding Thesis Award! Can't stop the big constant smile on my face :)
We're so excited for our first Hacky Hour at Kelvin Grove today! Looking forward to chatting technical skills and open research skills with friends old and new, 2-3pm today at Beadles! 👩🏾‍💻👩🏼‍💻👩🏻‍💻

We're hiring! The DMRC is seeking a motivated and innovative Centre Manager, ideally with experience managing a successful research environment. Please share with potential candidates! https://t.co/ufFnuPfrLy

6 Feb: KG at Beadles 2-3pm
13 Feb: GP at the Pantry 2-3pm
20 Feb: KG at Beadles 2-3pm
27 Feb: GP at the Pantry 2-3pm

If you're interested in the fake news and misinformation elements of the #IFEFutureForum - @Timothyjgraham and @Tobias_Keller have an article on bushfires, bots and arson claims on the @ConversationEDU. #RealWorldResearch #QUT

https://t.co/LeX5OWMn0Q

"I hate to use the metaphor, but misinformation is spreading like wildfire..." @Timothyjgraham on how audiences spread misinformation and fake news as the initial reaction to #AustraliaBurns is often an emotional one. #IFEFutureForum #QUT

Kelvin Grove friends, check this out, Hacky Hour will be coming to you next week and every second week after that! Come along with your coding, HPC, statistics etc questions or just for a chat about technical skills for research https://t.co/3oiPFXDVPj
Big news, QUT friends: starting next week, we will be alternating between Kelvin Grove and Gardens Point campuses! We'll be on 2pm Thursdays every week, just alternating locations
Marissa is speaking now at #lca2020 about Building ethical data infrastructure - her talk is being livestreamed at https://t.co/NHwz9sGXaZ https://t.co/8UKLMVmHFb

tweets.text: Last @GPHackyHour this year! Thanks to the teams from the Digital Observatory, eReseach, Library and Information Security for joining us and supporting researchers! We will be back on the 16th of January 2020 at The Pantry. Merry Xmas and Happy New Year!

The last @QUT Hacky Hour for 2019 is on today (Thurs 19 Dec), 2–3pm. IT experts help researchers with research-related IT Qs.
@QUTSciEng @IFE_QUT @QUTEcosounds @qutdmrc @qutlibrary @QUT_BDA @CPLRCQUT @QUTdesign @QUTHlthStudents @QUTISRN @QUTND @QUTphsw @QUTSESS @ObservatoryTeam https://t.co/Nlk1hmZk8R
Today is our last Hacky Hour for the year. Come along to The Pantry, Gardens Point from 2-3pm with any research questions  you have. Otherwise we'll be back on Thursday, 9 January.

urls.title: Twitter is removing precise-location tagging on tweets — a small win for privacy but a small loss for journalists and researchers
urls.description: For the past decade, location-tagged tweets have been a useful (if imperfect) tool for anyone trying to connect time, place, and information in ways that told us something about the world.
